definition: dark nebula (visible as a shadow, absorbing light from behind)/absorption nebula
variant of 暗[an4]
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
dark/gloomy/hidden/secret/muddled/obscure/in the dark
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: Stars are forming within the dark cloud.
sentences.chinese: 恒星正在该暗星云中形成。

sentences.english: The major use of this spectrograph is to observe the CO molecular spectral lines from dark clouds in the Galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 主要用于南天暗星云中一氧化碳分子谱线的观测研究。

sentences.english: Many of Barnard's dark nebulae are themselves likely sites of future star formation.
sentences.chinese: 许多巴纳德暗星云本身可能就是未来恒星诞生的地点。

sentences.english: The investigation of dark nebulas has been facilitated by a new discovery .
sentences.chinese: 对暗星云的研究被一种新发现所推进。

definition: Dijun, Shang dynasty protector God, possibly same as legendary Emperor 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
the intersection of the Moon's orbit with the ecliptic in Vedic astronomy (Sanskrit rahu)
clear sky
variant of 羅睺|罗睺[luo2 hou2]
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
the king of hell
God of heaven/Celestial emperor
Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
(honorific appellation of a deity)
to greet and usher in (guests, newcomers etc)/(Buddhism) to receive into the Pure Land
demonic/devil
Zhao Gongming, God of Wealth in the Chinese folk tradition and Taoism
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
to die out/to fade away/nirvana (Buddhism)
Odin (god in Norse mythology)
Ceaseless pain (Sanskrit: Avici), one of the Buddhist hells/fig. hell/hell on earth
